message: Any one here is using LESS to write CSS? Look at the provided example and its compiled version in the "Getting started", try to make sense of it, then tell me WHY the hell are you using it? #LetsTakeABeautifulSimpleLanguageAndMakeItUgly
story: Mohamed Eltantawi shared a link to the group: Egyptian Geeks.
name: Getting started | Less.js
caption: lesscss.org
description: Less extends CSS with dynamic behavior such as variables, mixins, operations and functions. Less runs on both the server-side (with Node.js and Rhino) or client-side (modern browsers only).

data.message: As for Sass, I kind of understand why it can be useful, but LESS? please...

I wasn't sure where to start, and was thinking about how long my reply will be, but if you understand why SASS, you understand why LESS. They do the same thing.

LESS was popular especially for .NET devs and for early Node devs when SASS was only a Ruby thing. Even SCSS didn't exist back in the days, and although I didn't check the exact history, I'd expect that  LESS helped greatly make SCSSS become the thing.

I wouldn't use LESS now. Not because it's bad, but because SASS (SCSS) is better. But I'd used LESS a lot years back when SASS was too not as accessible to me as .NET developer.
